text:
so it feels like Brexit is gone a bit
mad and there's less than five months to

go and no one really knows where it all
might end up Theresa May said ministers

had signed off the deal for the UK to
leave the EU the collective decision of

cabinet was that the government should
agree the draft withdrawal agreement and

the outline political declaration but
the next morning it was a different

story
the brexit secretary Dominic Raab has

resigned the man in charge of the brexit
talks said he wasn't up for that job

anymore because he didn't believe in
what had been agreed I think she needs a

Brexit secretary that will pursue the
deal that she wants to put to the country

with conviction I don't feel I can do
that in good conscience yep that was the

man who was supposed to be in charge of
brexit who's walked away and he's the

second one to quit that job not great
some more big names and some junior

ministers resigned as well Theresa May
had to go to Parliament to try to

convince MPs that the deal was the right
one and that they should back it once a

final deal is agreed I will bring it to
Parliament and I will ask MPs to

consider the national interest and give
it their backing, but getting MPs on board

is going to be the hardest part of this
process and at the moment it's looking

like no-one from any party is happy with
it

the government must now withdraw this
half-baked deal which is clear does not

have the backing of the cabinet this
Parliament or the country as a whole and
it's looking pretty rocky for the PM herself too
as what my right honourable friend

says and what my right honourable friend
does no longer match should I not write

to my right honourable friend the member
for Altrincham and Sale west

he means this guy Graham Brady who's in
charge of conservative MPs in Parliament

they can write to him saying they want a
different leader and so guess what
happened next

no of course it isn't it's
using the proper procedures of the

Conservative Party what we need is a
leader who will say to the European

Union it is impossible to divide up the
United Kingdom 48 letters in total and

there has to be a vote on whether to
either mate should still be the one in

charge
I believe with every fiber of my being

that the course I have set out is the
right one for our country and all our

people am I going to see this through
yes but even if the Prime Minister stays

it's not clear how any kind of brexit
deal let alone the one she's pushing

could get enough support in Westminster
to make it out alive
you
